item.title: Octopath Traveler 2: Where to Find Every Guild
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Every Basic Guild Location
  • How to Get Every Guild License
  • How to Get Every Hidden Job

Much like several Final Fantasy titles, Octopath Traveler 2 features a job system that lets characters swap out some of their abilities and weapons. And while each character has a permanent primary job that they can perform better than anyone else, they can also have a secondary job that makes them much more dangerous.

However, the problem with these secondary jobs is that you need to unlock them. Octopath Traveler 2 features a guild for every job, and you need to find them if you want your characters to multiclass. Each guild has its own unique location in the world, and this guide will help you locate and unlock them all.

Every Basic Guild Location

In general, all the guilds are in tier two locations, and every character starts in the same land as their guild. This means the Hunters Guild is in Toto'haha with Ochette, the Apothecaries Guild is in the Harborlands with Castti, and so on.

You can spot each guild on the radar, because they have a unique checkerboard shield icon that points to their location. Once you make contact with a guild, you can also find this icon next to the region or town they're in on the world map. However, this icon won't appear if you haven't found the guild.

Job

Region

Directions

Hunter

Toto'haha: Western Tropu'hopu Traverse

From the save point, go north into the ruins, then keep going west to find the guild tent

Apothecary

Harborlands: Conning Creek

Take the path south from the inn to the house with a garden

Thief

Brightlands: Clockbank

Head to the west end of the Industrial District and look for an arch behind some crates; enter the arch to climb a ladder (the thieves only appear at night)

Scholar

Winterlands: Western Winterbloom Snows

From the save point, head north across the bridge, then west up the stairs to reach the large stone library

Merchant

Wildlands: Western Crackridge Wilds

From the save point, go north, west across the land bridge, north across the wood bridge, then climb a ladder to reach the guild tent

Dancer

Leaflands: Wellgrove

Head up the path north and enter the house with the chest out front

Cleric

Crestlands: Borderfall

From the save point, head west up the path and go across the bridge to the church

Warrior

Hinoeuma: Sai

Head north to the large dojo

How to Get Every Guild License

Finding each guild is good enough to unlock one secondary job slot, but you can get more by earning licenses. This means that up to three characters can share the same secondary job at the same time, which is a good way to overwhelm an enemy with a particularly good job like Merchant or Scholar.

Job

Second License

Third License

Hunter

Quicksand Monster's Liver, beat the Lord of the Sands in Hinoeuma: Quicksand Gaol

Sea Monster's Whisker, beat the Scourge of the Sea, found in a whirlpool between Toto'haha and the Brightlands

Apothecary

3 Herb-of-Grace Buds, sold by a Black Market merchant in New Delsta Flats, keep switching to night until the right one appears

3 Primeval Horn Elixir, dropped by Devil Deer in House Wellows Manor dungeon, stealing may be more effective

Thief

Thieves Gem, inventory of Old Man by Clockbank entrance

Master Thief's Sapphire Stone, in a chest in Shipwreck of the Empress dungeon

Scholar

5 Ancient Sentinel Cores, dropped by sentinel enemies in The Roque Company: Factory in Clockbank

5 Almighty Soulstones, can steal from elemental enemies that appear at night in Western Winterbloom Snows

Merchant

Pay 100,000 leaves

Pay 300,000 leaves

Dancer

Have one Dancer who knows the Divine skill (Agnea counts)

Have two Dancers who know the Divine skill

Cleric

High Priest's Amulet, found in a chest in Starfall Spring off Southern Cropdale Trail

High Priest's Book of Scripture, beat the Dreadwolf in Beneath the Wall dungeon off Southern Stormhail Snows

Warrior

Have one Warrior who knows the Divine skill (Hikari counts)

Have two Warriors who know the Divine skill

Note that there are several places where you can find the Herb-of-Grace Buds, the Ancient Sentinel Cores, and the Almighty Soulstones. However, the methods listed are among the easiest ways of getting them. As for the Primeval Horn Elixirs, the Devil Deer appear to be the only source, and they only appear in the House Wellows Manor dungeon.

How to Get Every Hidden Job

Along with the eight basic jobs, you can also find four secret advanced jobs. Getting these jobs is more complicated than unlocking the basic guilds, and you only ever get one job slot for each one, but in exchange, these jobs have very useful skills you can't get anywhere else.

Advanced Job

Location

How to Earn

Inventor

A house in Brightlands: Eastern New Delsta Highroad

Speak to the inventor (the hard part is building the inventions)

Armsmaster

A house in Wildlands: Gravell

Knock out the Debt Collector in front of the door, speak to the Retired Blacksmith, bring him at least one Rusty weapon

Arcanist

The Sundering Sea: The Lost Isle (south of Clockbank)

Go west from the sign along an invisible path to find and speak to the Arcanist Descendant

Conjurer

Hinoeuma: Ku

Reach the top of the Five-Tiered Tower

item.title: Pax Dei: Beginners Tips And Tricks
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Character Creation
  • Starting Locations
  • Gathering Resources and Building
  • Get Your Hands On Tools
  • Upgrade Your Crafting Skills to Craft Better Equipment
  • Increase Your Combat Effectiveness With Combat Skills
  • Build And Upgrade Your Crafting Stations

Pax Dei is an MMORPG that breaks the norm in almost everything MMORPGs are known for, from quests and NPCs to scripted adventures like dungeons or raids. There's a building system similar to survival games, with no hunger bars in this one. You can settle down and create a homestead or meet up with friends to form an entire town or even a bandit gang. This beginner's guide comes with a to-do list and the major gameplay systems in the game. So, let’s get started.

Character Creation

At the onset of your first gameplay session, you will be offered many customization options to build your alter ego. This step is important because Pax Dei is essentially an MMO (Massively Multiplayer Online) game, which simply means that players will not be able to create their custom servers with settings that suit their preferences; there will always be an online server, where you will have to interact with random players.

Starting Locations

Once you’ve selected the character you want to move forward with, you must choose your starting location from one of four general regions (each consisting of multiple zones acting like servers):

Regions and Zones

  • Merrie: Down, Wiht, Ulaid, Ardbog, Gael
  • Kerys: Llydaw, Bronyr, Pladenn, Tremen, Ewyas, Dolavon
  • Ancien: Lavedan, Tolosa, Armanhac, Tursan, Gravas, Salias
  • Innis Gallia: Nones, Trecassis, Aras, Arennes, Langres, Jura

Every spot has a population meter where you can opt for crowded places or select isolated ones. Pick a terrain you prefer that is suitable for the biome and the look of each starting zone.

The Woods of Old and Eerie Pine Forest are biomes Gallia has on display. Forsaken Forest can be seen interacting with the Windswept Steppe, among more options. Vegetation and Resources are unique for each biome.

Gathering Resources and Building

After spawning into the game, your initial goal will be to collect stones, sticks, and berries to unlock crafting recipes. Just like other crafting-survival games, your first goal is to find a place to settle and build a roof over your head.

It accomplishes this by allowing you to claim a plot and open up your buildable area. Having done that, now is your time to gather abundant building materials.

Get Your Hands On Tools

Create some basic tools to farm resources quicker as a beginner. The usage and purpose of these tools are discussed below.

Construction Hammer

Used for building structures, allowing you to construct a basic shelter with walls, a door, and a roof.

Iron Chopping Axe

Essential for gathering wood, enabling you to cut down trees quickly for construction and crafting.

Stone Pickaxe

Used for mining stone and ores, helping you gather essential materials for building and crafting advanced items.

Upgrade Your Crafting Skills to Craft Better Equipment

Crafting skills are important as they enable you to create various items that enhance your gameplay, such as better equipment, consumables, and decorative items. Higher crafting skill levels allow you to craft more advanced and efficient items.

Furthermore, there’s a concept of Success Rate in Pax Dei . Each material that you can craft will have a success rate attached to it, and the level of your crafting skills will determine whether you will successfully be able to craft that specific item.

Failing to complete a crafting job would make you lose half of your materials. They will either fall to the ground or return to your inventory. On the brighter side, this would still help you gain experience, thereby contributing to your crafting skills overall.

Here are some primary crafting skills:

  • Winemaking and Brewing
  • Jewelry Making
  • Baking
  • Cooking
  • Tailoring
  • Alchemy
  • Charcuterie
  • Fletching
  • Leatherworking
  • Carpentry
  • Armor Smithing
  • Blacksmithing
  • Weapon Smithing
  • Herbalism
  • Mining
  • Woodcutting

Increase Your Combat Effectiveness With Combat Skills

Combat Skills are the key to survival in Pax Dei . These abilities increase your combat effectiveness, both against enemies and other players. As your skill level increases, so does your damage and defensive abilities.

However, it is vital to note that at the time of writing, the early access version of the game shows a rather lagging mechanism to the combat in this game. As a beginner, you’ll notice when you’re being attacked by wolves or bears, their attacks are not as smooth as other mechanics.

Although this is a disadvantage, you can respawn at a nearby shrine. Here are the main combat skills and their importance:

  • Axes
  • Block
  • Bows
  • Crossbows
  • Greataxes
  • Greatmauls
  • Greatswords
  • Handspears
  • Light Polearms
  • Maces
  • Polearms
  • Sledgehammers
  • Swords
  • Two-Handed Spears
  • Warhammer

Build And Upgrade Your Crafting Stations

The skill levels are linked to the progression system of the game. The higher your craft skill, the better items you can make, such as cutting down trees faster and using higher-level wood when leveling your woodcutting.

There are crafting stations for more higher-tier items in the game. To get started, build a Wood Chopping Block to unlock many common wood recipes quickly. Then, build a Carpenter's Workbench using the following:

  • 4 Rough Woods
  • 20 Wooden Pegs
  • 6 Rough Wooden Planks

You need crafting stations like charcoal kilns and furnaces to make metal ingots and other advanced resources.

item.title: Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree - How to Get Back to the Lands Between
item.description:
Elden RIng: Shadow of the Erdtree introduces a massive new region for players to explore. The Land of Shadow, as it is known, is a densely packed mix of incredibly dangerous foes and breathtakingly-beautiful sights. When you first enter the region, it can be slightly overwhelming. So much so, that you may even ask yourself, how do I get back to the Lands Between?

Traveling to and from the Land of Shadow is actually quite simple in Shadow of the Erdtree. However, the game itself does not go out of its way to show or tell you how to exit the Land of Shadow. This guide will explain how to accomplish this feat, and make sure players can return to the Roundtable Hold.

How to Get Back to The Lands Between in Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree

When you first enter the Land of Shadow, there will be so much to see and do, you likely will not think about returning to the Roudntable Hold or the Lands Between. With multiple new weapon types to acquire, and new boons like Shadow of the Erdtree 's Scadutree Blessings , you will be thoroughly occupied. However, what happens when you acquire Elden Ring 's new Anvil Hammer, and you want to upgrade it at the forge? This is when you realize the Miquellan Knight never told you how to leave the Land of Shadow.

Many modern DLC's make you utilize a specific travel mechanism to switch between maps, but Shadow of the Erdtree makes it far less complicated to travel between the Lands Between and the Land of Shadow. The simple answer is that you can simply fast-travel back and forth between regions, as if the Land of Shadow were simply another part of the base game. When you open the map, press Y/ Triangle to open up the list of sites of grace, and use the bumpers (LB/RB or L1/R1) to switch regions. You can also press X/Square to return to the Table of Lost Grace at the Roundtable Hold. There you can upgrade your weapons and spirit ashes.

item.title: Best Strategy Games That Mix History And Fantasy
item.description:
Combining history and fantasy in a video game is an excellent setting that developers have leveraged often. In most cases, these games are set in a time period that has not quite passed into legend, and is just on the cusp of recorded history. This gives developers the freedom to take creative license, but still maintain some level of realism.

Of course, a mixture of history and fantasy also sets the scene for epic battles and grand struggles, both of which fit well within the strategy game genre. Gather resources, raise an army, and stomp the neighbors: it's a proven gameplay loop that these titles do well.

6 Citadels

Legend Meets Fantasy

  • Platforms: Microsoft Windows
  • Released: July 25, 2013
  • Developer: Games Distillery, bitComposer Interactive
  • Genre: Real-time strategy

Citadels is a real-time strategy game that surrounds the Legend of King Arthur and his Knights of the Round Table. It's based on a historically correct timeline, yet populated by heroes and iconic figures that are part of the Legend of Arthur. The player can choose to fight on the side of Arthur, or as his enemy.

Much of the gameplay in Citadels , as the name suggests, revolves around building a stronghold or fortress, and raising an unbeatable army. Resources need to be gathered, and battles won. By completing special tasks, the player can unlock hero units and other historical figures, such as Merlin the Magician, which will open up new strategic options. Anyone that has an interest in the Legend of Arthur might like to give this game a try.

5 Robin Hood: The Legend of Sherwood

Part History, Part Legend

The story of Robin Hood is an excellent setting for a historical fantasy game. Did Robin Hood exist? Many of the facts of the story ring true, such as Prince John taking over the throne for his brother, Richard the Lionheart, who was imprisoned at this time. But in all likelihood, Robin Hood was a fantasy creation, an amalgamation. His many reported deeds were actually carried out by a number of different people around the same time.

Robin Hood: The Legend of Sherwood takes the legend of Robin Hood and uses key aspects of the story to create a non-linear campaign. The player can choose who they wish to be in the campaign, including Robin Hood himself, Friar Tuck, Little John, or Maid Marian. The game itself takes place on a map populated with locations that are entrenched in the legend, such as Nottingham Castle and Sherwood Forest.

The player can carry out activities such as castle raids, ambushes, and, of course, robberies. This isn’t a grand fantasy game per se; there are no orcs or goblins. Instead, it combines documented history with a fantasy adaptation of the story of Robin Hood.

4 Stronghold Legends

Fantasy Castle Builder

The Stronghold franchise has become synonymous with great castle-building strategy games. However, most games in the franchise, such as Stronghold: Crusader , tried to stay true to the history of the era they were set within. Stronghold Legends takes a different turn.

Stronghold Legends brings in fantasy aspects, such as monsters and magic, but still manages to throw in some history as well. The player can select one of three factions, two of which are historically inspired. These are Vlad the Impaler (or Vlad Dracula, as the game calls him) and Siegfried of Xanten. The third faction is King Arthur and his knights, which, of course, is based on a legend.

There are 23 interlinked missions the player can tackle. The general Stronghold premise of constructing a castle, gathering resources, and building an army holds true with Stronghold Legends . But the player will find that the campaign is very different. Rather than the old-school RTS style of throwing the player into battle after battle, Stronghold Legends intermixes non-combat-related challenges as well.

3 Age of Mythology

Historically Influenced Strategy Game

This game was actually a spin-off from the Age of Empires franchise. It features a mix of historically influenced factions, such as Egypt and Greece, but populates them with fantasy creatures such as Cyclops and other monsters. The gameplay revolves around guiding the player’s chosen faction through four separate ages; the Archaic Age, the Classical Age, the Heroic Age, and the Mythic Age.

As with most strategy games where the player has to expand their empire, Age of Mythology requires the player to gather materials such as food, wood, and gold, to construct buildings and units, expanding their power base. There is also a fourth resource, favor, which is granted by the gods and is spent on training mythical units. Age of Mythology is an older game, but one that took the popular Age of Empires format and mixed it up enough to become something unique in its own right.

2 Legion: Legend of Excalibur

Dark Sorcery Begins This Historical Game

  • Platforms: PlayStation 2
  • Released: June 17, 2002
  • Developer: 7 Studios, Westwood Studios
  • Genre: Strategy Game

Legion: Legend of Excalibur is another game that takes the Legend of King Arthur, with its loose basis on the history of the time period, and spins it into a fantasy adventure. The game begins with Morgan le Fay, the Dark Sorceress, attacking and murdering her father, Uther Pendragon. Her intent is to take over the Kingdom of Camelot. But of course, her younger brother Arthur, with his magic sword Excalibur, is in opposition.

The player takes on the role of young Arthur. With his group of allies, including Merlin, and the knights Galahad, Percival, and Lancelot, he must defeat the evil forces of Morgan le Fay. This period in the history of the British Isles is an excellent setting for a strategy game. Just enough of the history of this time period has remained to add to the story's believability.

1 Northgard

Viking History With A Splash Of Fantasy

Northgard pays homage to Norse mythology and legend, but also throws in fantasy aspects in the form of the enemies the player encounters. These include Draugr dwarves, zombie dragons, and rock golems, to name a few. The player takes on the role of Prince Rig, whose father, the High King, was murdered by the leader of the Clan of the Raven, Hagen. This sets the scene for the campaign mode.

The gameplay in Northgard doesn’t follow the typical empire-building strategy game, due to the way the map is handled. Each map has four zones, and each zone has a particular resource. With this setup, establishing a robust supply chain means controlling certain parts of the map, which is easier said than done due to enemy action. Northgard is a great strategy game, with tons of replayability for anyone that has an interest in Norse mythology.

item.title: Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree – How To Get & Use Scadutree Fragments
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Get Scadutree Fragments in Shadow of the Erdtree
  • How to Use Scadutree Fragments in Shadow of the Erdtree

To balance combat and difficulty for those diving into Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree with fully built characters and OP builds, FromSoftware has introduced a separate leveling system unique to the DLC area in the form of the Scadutree Fragment s.

Collecting and using these Fragments to obtain the Scadutree Blessing is the main way for players to increase their strength in the Shadow Realm. Here’s how.

How to Get Scadutree Fragments in Shadow of the Erdtree

Similar to Golden Seed s and Sacred Tear s, Scadutree Fragments can be found spread out across the open world in the DLC, mainly obtainable via exploration.

  • Miquella’s Crosses : Miquella’s Footsteps or Crosses are giant, glowing yellow landmarks in the shape of a large scythe that are typically found near a Site of Grace. Beneath every Cross will be a single purple item containing a Scadutree Fragment.
  • Shadow Pot Enemies : Among the new enemy types introduced in the DLC are the Shadows—pitch-black undead enemies that often move in groups. There are different variants of these Shadow enemies, and one of them is instantly recognizable by a glowing pot it carries on its head, supported by both hands. Killing the Shadow Pot enemy has a chance of dropping a Scadutree Fragment or a Revered Spirit Ash (or nothing at all).
  • Headless Statues : During exploration, players will encounter large statues of a headless woman with her arms wide open (presumably, this is Marika). Underneath each statue will be a Scadutree Fragment.
  • Boss Drops : Certain bosses in Shadow of the Erdtree —like the Golden Hippopotamus—have a 100% chance to drop a Scadutree Fragment.

Shadow Pot enemies are not farmable for Scadutree Fragments.

How to Use Scadutree Fragments in Shadow of the Erdtree

Players can use Scadutree Fragments at any Site of Grace.

  1. Interact with the Site of Grace to bring up the menu.
  2. Select ‘ Shadow Realm Blessing ’.
  3. Choose ‘ Scadutree Blessing ’.
  4. Click ‘YES’ when prompted.

If you have enough Fragments to increase the level of your Blessing, it will go up by one. The first level of the Blessing costs 1 Fragment, but the price for subsequent upgrades goes up.

Scadutree Blessing increases the damage you deal and reduces the damage you take by a fixed percentage. The boost to survivability is massive, and something players should actively seek out if they’re having trouble tackling content in the DLC.

The effects of Shadow Realm Blessings (Revered Spirit Ash and Scadutree) are confined to the Shadow Realm and will have no effect in the base game.

To give an idea of how much of a difference the Scadutree Blessing makes, a level 180 character without any blessings loses half of their HP when hit by a single attack from an enemy in the starting area. The same character, with the same gear and talismans but with one Scadutree Blessing, loses one-third of their HP when hit by the same attack. Obtaining these Fragments and Blessings is not required to play, but it will make surviving a whole lot easier.
